block.p: Aimee Elizabeth Nassau and Sargent Collier Gardiner were married yesterday by the Rev. Jack S. Miller, a Presbyterian minister, at the First Congregational Church in Washington, Conn.

The bride, 29, is an associate at Friedman, Wang & Bleiberg, a law firm in New York. She graduated from Dartmouth College and Fordham University Law School. Her father, Robert Nassau, lives in Lahaina, Hawaii. He is an owner of Maui Brews, a restaurant there. Her mother, AnnRae Nassau, lives in Ann Arbor, Mich. She is a real estate sales associate with the Charles Reinhart Company there.
Aimee Elizabeth Nassau and Sargent Collier Gardiner were married yesterday by the Rev. Jack S. Miller, a Presbyterian minister, at the First Congregational Church in Washington, Conn.

The bride, 29, is an associate at Friedman, Wang & Bleiberg, a law firm in New York. She graduated from Dartmouth College and Fordham University Law School. Her father, Robert Nassau, lives in Lahaina, Hawaii. He is an owner of Maui Brews, a restaurant there. Her mother, AnnRae Nassau, lives in Ann Arbor, Mich. She is a real estate sales associate with the Charles Reinhart Company there.

Mr. Gardiner, 31, was until last month, an architectural designer with Rockwell Architecture, Planning and Design in New York. Next month,, he is to join Robert A. M. Stern Architects in New York. He graduated from Cornell and received a master's degree in architecture from the University of Pensylvania.

He is a son of Eleanor Dwight and Daniel Gardiner, both of New York. The bridegroom's mother is the author of ''Edith Wharton: An Extraordinary Life'' (Harry N. Abrams, 1994). His father retired as a partner in W. H. Reaves, investment advisers in Jersey City.
